Description: Moodle's LTI provider library did not utilise Moodle's inbuilt cURL helper, which resulted in a blind SSRF risk.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.4, 3.11 to 3.11.10, 3.9 to 3.9.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71920 Blind SSRF risk in LTI provider library

Description: The "social" user profile field type performed insufficient escaping on some fields, resulting in a stored XSS risk.
Workaround:: Update "social" user profile fields so their visibility is set to "not visible", until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-76131 Stored XSS possible in some "social" user profile fields

Description: The return URL in the policy tool required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.4, 3.11 to 3.11.10, 3.9 to 3.9.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-76091 Reflected XSS risk in policy tool

Description: A user's CSRF token was unnecessarily included in the URL when being redirected to a course they have just restored.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.4, 3.11 to 3.11.10, 3.9 to 3.9.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-75862 Course restore - CSRF token passed in course redirect URL

Description: An upstream security patch was applied to the third party VideoJS library included with Moodle, on versions affected by an XSS risk.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.10, 3.9 to 3.9.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-75278 Apply upstream security fix to VideoJS library to remove XSS risk

Description: Insufficient limitations in some quiz web services made it possible for students to bypass sequential navigation during a quiz attempt.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.2, 3.11 to 3.11.8, 3.9 to 3.9.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-75210 Quiz sequential navigation bypass using web services

Description: The H5P activity attempts report did not filter by groups, which in separate groups mode could reveal information to non-editing teachers about attempts/users in groups they should not have access to.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.3, 3.11 to 3.11.9, 3.9 to 3.9.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Access to this feature can be revoked by removing the mod/h5pactivity:reviewattempts capability from relevant users until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-71662 and MDL-72012 No groups filtering in H5P activity attempts report

Description: A limited SQL injection risk was identified in the "browse list of users" site administration page.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.3, 3.11 to 3.11.9, 3.9 to 3.9.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-75283 Minor SQL injection risk in admin user browsing

Description: A remote code execution risk when restoring backup files originating from Moodle 1.9 was identified.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.3, 3.11 to 3.11.9, 3.9 to 3.9.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-75405 Remote code execution risk when restoring malformed backup file from Moodle 1.9

Description: Recursive rendering of Mustache template helpers containing user input could, in some cases, result in an XSS risk or a page failing to load.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.3, 3.11 to 3.11.9, 3.9 to 3.9.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-68066 Stored XSS and page denial of service risks due to recursive rendering in Mustache template helpers

Description: Enabling and disabling installed H5P libraries did not include the necessary token to prevent a CSRF risk.
Tracker issue:: MDL-75326 CSRF risk in enabling/disabling installed H5P libraries

Description: The Mustache template library included with Moodle has been upgraded to the latest version, which includes a fix for a serious security issue.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.2, 3.11 to 3.11.8, 3.9 to 3.9.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-75388 Upgrade Mustache to latest version (upstream)

Description: A minor reflected XSS risk was identified in the LTI module. This did not impact authenticated users.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.1, 3.11 to 3.11.7, 3.9 to 3.9.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72299 LTI module reflected XSS risk - affecting unauthenticated users only

Description: The mobile auto-login URL required additional sanitizing to prevent an open redirect risk.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.1, 3.11 to 3.11.7, 3.9 to 3.9.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72171 Open redirect risk in mobile auto-login feature

Description: Insufficient sanitizing of SCORM track details presented stored XSS and blind SSRF risks.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.1, 3.11 to 3.11.7, 3.9 to 3.9.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71921 Stored XSS and blind SSRF possible via SCORM track details

Description: Insufficient path checks in a lesson question import resulted in an arbitrary file read risk. The capability to access this feature is only available to teachers, managers and admins by default.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.1, 3.11 to 3.11.7, 3.9 to 3.9.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72029 Arbitrary file read when importing lesson questions

Description: An omitted execution parameter resulted in a remote code execution risk for sites running GhostScript versions older than 9.50.
Versions affected:: 4.0 to 4.0.1, 3.11 to 3.11.7, 3.9 to 3.9.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Ensure older versions of GhostScript are upgraded to 9.50 or newer.
Tracker issue:: MDL-75044 PostScript Code Injection / Remote code execution risk

Description: An issue in the logic used to count failed login attempts could result in the account lockout threshold being bypassed.
Versions affected:: 4.0, 3.11 to 3.11.6, 3.10 to 3.10.10, 3.9 to 3.9.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-73736 Failed login attempts counted incorrectly

Description: An SQL injection risk was identified in Badges code relating to configuring criteria.
Versions affected:: 4.0, 3.11 to 3.11.6, 3.10 to 3.10.10, 3.9 to 3.9.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: In versions earlier than Moodle 4.0, 3.11.6, 3.10.10 and 3.9.13, remove the moodle/badges:configurecriteria capability from users to prevent them accessing the affected functionality until the patch is applied (in newer versions this is not necessary).
Tracker issue:: MDL-74333 SQL injection risk in badge award criteria

Description: Global search results could include author information on some activities where a user may not otherwise have access to it.
Versions affected:: 4.0, 3.11 to 3.11.6, 3.10 to 3.10.10, 3.9 to 3.9.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71623 Global search results reveal authors of content unexpectedly for some activities

Description: The description user field was not hidden when being set as a hidden user field.
Versions affected:: 4.0, 3.11 to 3.11.6, 3.10 to 3.10.10, 3.9 to 3.9.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-74318 Description field hidden by user policies (hiddenuserfields) is still visible

Description: ID numbers displayed when bulk allocating markers to assignments required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.
Versions affected:: 4.0, 3.11 to 3.11.6, 3.10 to 3.10.10, 3.9 to 3.9.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-74204 Stored XSS in assignment bulk marker allocation form via user ID number

Description: Users with the capability to configure badge criteria (teachers and managers by default) were able to configure course badges with profile field criteria, which should only be available for site badges.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.5, 3.10 to 3.10.9, 3.9 to 3.9.12 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Remove the moodle/badges:configurecriteria capability from users to prevent them accessing the relevant functionality until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-74075 Possible to reach the profile field badge criteria on a course page

Description: Insufficient capability checks could allow users with the moodle/site:uploadusers capability to delete users, without having the necessary moodle/user:delete capability.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.5, 3.10 to 3.10.9, 3.9 to 3.9.12 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Remove the moodle/site:uploadusers capability from users who do not also have the moodle/user:delete capability, until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-72972 Users with moodle/site:uploadusers but without moodle/user:delete could delete users

Description: An SQL injection risk was identified in Badges code relating to configuring criteria. Access to the relevant capability was limited to teachers and managers by default.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.5, 3.10 to 3.10.9, 3.9 to 3.9.12 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Remove the moodle/badges:configurecriteria capability from users to prevent them accessing the affected functionality until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-74074 SQL injection risk in Badges criteria code

Description: The "delete badge alignment" functionality did not include the necessary token check to prevent a CSRF risk.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.4, 3.10 to 3.10.8, 3.9 to 3.9.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72367 CSRF risk in badge alignment deletion

Description: Insufficient capability checks could lead to users accessing their grade report for courses where they did not have the required gradereport/user:view capability.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.4, 3.10 to 3.10.8, 3.9 to 3.9.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72772 Capability gradereport/user:view not always respected when navigating to a user's course grade report

Description: Hi everyone,
The calendar:manageentries capability allowed managers to access or modify any calendar event, but should have been restricted from accessing user level events.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.4, 3.10 to 3.10.8, 3.9 to 3.9.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71239 calendar:manageentries capability allows CRUD access to all calendar events

Description: An SQL injection risk was identified in the h5p activity web service responsible for fetching user attempt data.
Tracker issue:: MDL-72573 SQL injection risk in code fetching h5p activity user attempts

Description: Insufficient capability checks made it possible to fetch other users' calendar action events.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71918 IDOR in a calendar web service allows fetching of other users' action events

Description: The "delete related badge" functionality did not include the necessary token check to prevent a CSRF risk.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72370 CSRF risk on delete related badge feature

Description: Hola,
A URL parameter in the filetype site administrator tool required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-72571 Reflected XSS in filetype admin tool

Description: A remote code execution risk when restoring backup files was identified.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70823 Remote code execution risk when restoring malformed backup file

Description: It was possible for a student to view their quiz grade before it had been released, using a quiz web service.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.2, 3.10 to 3.10.6, 3.9 to 3.9.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71797 Quiz unreleased grade disclosure via web service

Description: Insufficient escaping of the LaTeX preamble made it possible for site administrators to read files available to the HTTP server system account.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.2, 3.10 to 3.10.6, 3.9 to 3.9.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Hard-code the value of the LaTeX preamble into $CFG->forced_plugin_settings['filter_tex']['latexpreamble'] within the site's config.php file.
Tracker issue:: MDL-71240 Arbitrary file read by site administrators via LaTeX preamble

Description: An authentication bypass risk was identified in the external database authentication functionality, due to a type juggling vulnerability.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.2, 3.10 to 3.10.6, 3.9 to 3.9.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71160 Authentication bypass risk when using external database authentication

Description: Insufficient capability checks made it possible for teachers to download users outside of their courses.
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.2, 3.10 to 3.10.6, 3.9 to 3.9.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71726 Course participants download did not restrict which users could be exported

Description: A session hijack risk was identified in the Shibboleth authentication plugin. (Note: Shibboleth authentication is disabled by default in Moodle.)
Versions affected:: 3.11 to 3.11.2, 3.10 to 3.10.6, 3.9 to 3.9.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71976 Session Hijack risk when Shibboleth authentication is enabled

Description: In some circumstances, email notifications of messages could have the link back to the original message hidden by HTML, which may pose a phishing risk.
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71919 Messaging email notifications containing HTML may hide the final line of the email

Description: Users' names required additional sanitizing in the account confirmation email, to prevent a self-registration phishing risk.
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-58393 Insufficient escaping of users' names in account confirmation email

Description: ID numbers exported in HTML data formats required additional sanitizing to prevent a local stored XSS risk. Note that the XSS was part of the locally downloaded file and not on the Moodle site's domain.
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71981 Stored XSS when exporting to data formats supporting HTML via user ID number

Description: Insufficient capability checks made it possible to remove other users' calendar URL subscriptions.
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71978 IDOR allows removal of other users' calendar URL subscriptions

Description: ID numbers displayed in the quiz override screens required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.
Tracker issue:: MDL-71898 Stored XSS in quiz override screens via user ID number

Description: ID numbers displayed in the web service token list required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.
Tracker issue:: MDL-71760 Stored XSS in the web service token list via user ID number

Description: Insufficient capability checks meant message deletions were not limited to the current user.
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71917 Messaging web service allows deletion of other users' messages

Description: Insufficient redirect handling made it possible to blindly bypass cURL blocked hosts/allowed ports restrictions, resulting in a blind SSRF risk. (Note: The request response was still blocked and not available to the user.)
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71916 Blind SSRF possible against cURL blocked hosts via redirect

Description: The file repository's URL parsing required additional recursion handling to mitigate the risk of recursion denial of service.
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71922 Recursion denial of service possible due to recursive cURL in file repository

Description: A remote code execution risk was identified in the Shibboleth authentication plugin. (Note: Shibboleth authentication is disabled by default in Moodle.)
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71957 Remote code execution risk when Shibboleth authentication is enabled

Description: An SQL injection risk was identified in the library fetching a user's recent courses
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71242 SQL injection risk in code fetching recent courses

Description: An SQL injection risk was identified in the library fetching a user's enrolled courses
Versions affected:: 3.11, 3.10 to 3.10.4, 3.9 to 3.9.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71241 SQL injection risk in code fetching enrolled courses

Description: The redirect URI in the LTI authorization endpoint required extra sanitizing to prevent reflected XSS and open redirect risks.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.3, 3.9 to 3.9.6, 3.8 to 3.8.8 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70622 Reflected XSS and open redirect in LTI authorization endpoint

Description: The last time a user accessed the mobile app is displayed on their profile page, but should be restricted to users with the relevant capability (site administrators by default).
Tracker issue:: MDL-71513 Last app access time is visible to non-site-admins on user profile page

Description: A denial-of-service risk was identified in the draft files area, due to it not respecting user file upload limits.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.3, 3.9 to 3.9.6, 3.8 to 3.8.8, 3.5 to 3.5.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-69028 Files API should mitigate denial-of-service risk when adding to the draft file area

Description: ID numbers displayed in the quiz grading report required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.3, 3.9 to 3.9.6, 3.8 to 3.8.8, 3.5 to 3.5.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-71130 Stored XSS in quiz grading report via user ID number

Description: An SQL injection risk existed on sites with MNet enabled and configured, via an XML-RPC call from the connected peer host. Note that this required site administrator access or access to the keypair.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.3, 3.9 to 3.9.6, 3.8 to 3.8.8, 3.5 to 3.5.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70804 Blind SQL injection possible via MNet authentication

Description: It was possible for a student to view their quiz grade before it had been released, using a quiz web service.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.3, 3.9 to 3.9.6, 3.8 to 3.8.8, 3.5 to 3.5.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70720 Quiz unreleased grade disclosure via web service

Description: Teachers exporting a forum in CSV format could receive a CSV of forums from all courses in some circumstances.
Workaround:: Remove the Export Forum (mod/forum:exportforum) capability from non-admin roles/users until the patch has been applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-71359 Forum CSV export could result in posts from all courses being exported

Description: The JQuery version used by Moodle required upgrading to 3.5.1 to patch some published potential vulnerabilities.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.1, 3.9 to 3.9.4, 3.8 to 3.8.7, 3.5 to 3.5.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-69680 JQuery versions below 3.5.0 contains some potential vulnerabilities

Description: The web service responsible for fetching other users' enrolled courses did not validate that the requesting user had permission to view that information in each course.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.1, 3.9 to 3.9.4, 3.8 to 3.8.7, 3.5 to 3.5.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70822 Fetching a user's enrolled courses via web services did not check profile access in each course

Description: When creating a user account, it was possible to verify the account without having access to the verification email link/secret.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.1, 3.9 to 3.9.4, 3.8 to 3.8.7, 3.5 to 3.5.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70668 Bypass email verification secret when confirming account registration

Description: It was possible for some users without permission to view other users' full names to do so via the online users block.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.1, 3.9 to 3.9.4, 3.8 to 3.8.7, 3.5 to 3.5.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Hide the online users block (via Site administration > Plugins > Blocks > Manage blocks) until the patch has been applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-59293 User full name disclosure within online users block

Description: Text-based feedback answers required additional sanitizing to prevent stored XSS and blind SSRF risks.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.1, 3.9 to 3.9.4, 3.8 to 3.8.7, 3.5 to 3.5.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-70767 Stored XSS and blind SSRF possible via feedback answer text

Description: The ID number user profile field required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.
Versions affected:: 3.10 to 3.10.1, 3.9 to 3.9.4, 3.8 to 3.8.7, 3.5 to 3.5.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Disable the ID number field by unchecking it in Site admin > Users > User policies > Show user identity, until the patch has been applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-65552 Stored XSS via ID number user profile field

Description: It was possible for site administrators to execute arbitrary PHP scripts via a PHP include used during Shibboleth authentication.
Versions affected:: 3.10, 3.9 to 3.9.3, 3.8 to 3.8.6, 3.5 to 3.5.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Harcode preventexecpath to true in config.php, which prevents site administrators setting some executable paths via the UI. See https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/report/security/report_security_check_preventexecpath for more details.
Tracker issue:: MDL-68486 Arbitrary PHP code execution by site admins via Shibboleth configuration

Description: If the TeX notation filter was enabled, additional sanitizing of TeX content was required to prevent the risk of stored XSS.
Versions affected:: 3.10, 3.9 to 3.9.3, 3.8 to 3.8.6, 3.5 to 3.5.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Disable the TeX notation filter until the patch has been applied. (Note that this filter is disabled by default.)
Tracker issue:: MDL-69911 Stored XSS possible via TeX notation filter

Description: Hello, I have created a Moodle site used for distance teaching of the Italian language, where over 2000 school students connect every day to take online lessons. Yesterday it was asked to update the version of Moodle and later PHP.
Messaging did not impose a character limit when sending messages, which could result in client-side (browser) denial of service for users receiving very large messages.
Versions affected:: 3.10, 3.9 to 3.9.3, 3.8 to 3.8.6, 3.5 to 3.5.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-67782 Client side denial of service via personal message

Description: Insufficient capability checks in some grade related web services meant students were able to view other students' grades.
Tracker issue:: MDL-69797 Grade information disclosure in grade's external fetch functions

Description: Some search inputs were vulnerable to reflected XSS due to insufficient escaping of search queries.
Tracker issue:: MDL-70571 Search input template insufficiently escaped search queries

Description: The participants table download always included user emails, but should have only done so when users' emails are not hidden.
Tracker issue:: MDL-69844 The participants table download feature did not respect the site's "show user identity" configuration

Description: It was possible to include JavaScript when re-naming content bank items.
Tracker issue:: MDL-69046 Stored XSS possible when renaming content bank items

Description: If the upload course tool was used to delete an enrolment method which did not exist or was not already enabled, the tool would erroneously enable that enrolment method. This could lead to unintended users gaining access to the course.
Versions affected:: 3.9 to 3.9.2, 3.8 to 3.8.5, 3.7 to 3.7.8 and 3.5 to 3.5.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Until the patch is applied, ensure any enrolment method deletions are only performed on courses where that enrolment method already exists and is enabled.
Tracker issue:: MDL-69378 tool_uploadcourse creates new enrol instances unexpectedly in some circumstances

Description: Some database module web services allowed students to add entries within groups they did not belong to.
Versions affected:: 3.9 to 3.9.2, 3.8 to 3.8.5, 3.7 to 3.7.8, 3.5 to 3.5.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-67015 Some database module web services did not respect group settings

Description: Hi,
Insufficient capability checks could lead to users with the ability to course restore adding additional capabilities to roles within that course.
Versions affected:: 3.9 to 3.9.2, 3.8 to 3.8.5, 3.7 to 3.7.8, 3.5 to 3.5.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-56310 Privilege escalation within a course when restoring role overrides

Description: It was possible to include JavaScript in a book's chapter title, which was not escaped on the "Add new chapter" page.

Description: The decompressed size of zip files was not checked against available user quota before unzipping them, which could lead to a denial of service risk.
Versions affected:: 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-65115 Denial of service risk in file picker unzip functionality

Description: Users with "Log in as" capability in a course context (typically, course managers) may gain access to some site administration capabilities by "logging in as" a System manager.

Tracker issue:: MDL-68974 "Log in as" capability in a course context may lead to some privilege escalation

Description: The filter in the tag manager required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.

Description: The moodlenetprofile user profile field required extra sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.
Tracker issue:: MDL-69240 Stored XSS via moodlenetprofile parameter in user profile

Description: yui_combo needed to limit the amount of files it can load to help mitigate the risk of denial of service.

Tracker issue:: MDL-68426 yui_combo should mitigate denial of service risk

Tracker issue:: MDL-69093 Course enrolments allowed privilege escalation from teacher role into manager role

Description: The filter in the admin task log required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.
Tracker issue:: MDL-69128 Reflected XSS in admin task logs filter

Description: The JQuery version used by the H5P library contained a prototype pollution risk, which has now been updated to a patched version.
Tracker issue:: MDL-68704 Vulnerable JavaScript libraries: jQuery 1.9.1 (upstream)

Description: It was possible to create a SCORM package in such a way that when added to a course, it could be interacted with via web services in order to achieve remote code execution.
Versions affected:: 3.8 to 3.8.2, 3.7 to 3.7.5, 3.6 to 3.6.9, 3.5 to 3.5.11 and earlier unsupported versions

Description: MathJax versions 2.7.2 and earlier contain a stored XSS risk. The MathJax URL has been updated to reference a newer version, which has the vulnerability patched.

Description: Insufficient input escaping was applied to the PHP unit webrunner admin tool.

Tracker issue:: MDL-56287 Grade history report does not respect Separate groups mode in the course settings

Description: Fatal error messages required extra sanitizing to prevent reflected XSS risks on some pages.
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.2, 3.6 to 3.6.6, 3.5 to 3.5.8 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-66161 Reflected XSS possible from some fatal error messages

Description: Tokens used to fetch inline attachments in email notifications were not disabled when a user's account was no longer active. Note: to access files, a user would need to know the file path, and their token.
Tracker issue:: MDL-66377 Email media URL tokens were not checking for user status

Description: An open redirect existed in the Lesson edit page.
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.2, 3.6 to 3.6.6, 3.5 to 3.5.8 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-66228 Open redirect in Lesson edit page

Description: User emails required additional sanitizing to prevent blind XSS risk on some pages.
Tracker issue:: MDL-66762 Blind XSS reflected in some locations where user email is displayed

Description: OAuth 2 providers who do not verify users' email address changes require additional verification during sign-up to reduce the risk of account compromise.
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.2, 3.6 to 3.6.6, 3.5 to 3.5.8 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Disable login via OAuth 2 providers that may be affected, until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-66598 Add additional verification for some OAuth 2 logins to prevent account compromise

Description: When a cohort role assignment was removed, the associated capabilites were not being revoked (where applicable).
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.2, 3.6 to 3.6.6, 3.5 to 3.5.8 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-66257 Assigned Role in Cohort did not un-assign on removal

Description: Messages required extra sanitizing before updating the conversation overview, to prevent the risk of stored XSS.
Workaround:: Disable the messaging system until the patch has been applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-67637 Stored XSS in message conversation overview

Description: If a forum's subscription mode was set to "forced subscription", the forum's subscribe link contained an open redirect.
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.1, 3.6 to 3.6.5, 3.5 to 3.5.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Set a different subscription mode (eg optional or auto) on forums until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-55451 Forum subscribe link contained an open redirect if forced subscription mode was enabled

Description: The mobile launch endpoint contained an open redirect in some circumstances, which could result in a user's mobile access token being exposed. (Note: This does not affect sites with a forced URL scheme configured, mobile service disabled, or where the mobile app login method is "via the app").
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.1, 3.6 to 3.6.5, 3.5 to 3.5.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Configure the "Forced URL scheme" (forcedurlscheme) option in site administration to either the app's custom URL scheme, or "moodlemobile" for sites using the standard Moodle app. Alternative workaround options include disabling mobile service (enablemobilewebservice), or changing the mobile app login method (typeoflogin) to "via the app" if possible (instead of via SSO plugin) until the patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-66501 Open redirect in the mobile launch endpoint could be used to expose mobile access tokens

Description: Activity creation capabilities were not correctly respected when selecting the activity to use for a course in single activity mode.
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.1, 3.6 to 3.6.5, 3.5 to 3.5.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-66187 Activity :addinstance capabilities were not respected when creating a course in single activity format

Description: Users with the capability to create courses were assigned as a teacher in those courses, regardless of whether they had the capability to be automatically assigned that role.
Versions affected:: 3.7 to 3.7.1, 3.6 to 3.6.5, 3.5 to 3.5.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-66181 Course creation did not check the creator's role assignment capability before automatically assigning them as a teacher in the course

Description: The third party TCPDF library used by Moodle required updating to patch bug fixes, including a security fix (see CVE for more details).
Versions affected:: 3.7, 3.6 to 3.6.4, 3.5 to 3.5.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-64794 Upgrade TCPDF library for PHP 7.3 and bug fixes (upstream)

Description: Teachers in an assignment group could modify group overrides for other groups in the same assignment.
Versions affected:: 3.7, 3.6 to 3.6.4, 3.5 to 3.5.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-61114 Assignment group overrides did not observe separate groups mode

Description: Teachers in a quiz group could modify group overrides for other groups in the same quiz.
Versions affected:: 3.7, 3.6 to 3.6.4, 3.5 to 3.5.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-34411 Quiz group overrides did not observe groups membership or accessallgroups

Description: Users with permission to delete entries from a glossary were able to delete entries from other glossaries they did not have direct access to.
Versions affected:: 3.7, 3.6 to 3.6.4, 3.5 to 3.5.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-64623 Ability to delete glossary entries that belong to another glossary

Description: A sesskey (CSRF) token was not being utilised by the XML loading/unloading admin tool.
Versions affected:: 3.7, 3.6 to 3.6.4, 3.5 to 3.5.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-53689 Missing sesskey (CSRF) token in loading/unloading xml files

Description: The size of users' private file uploads via email were not correctly checked, so their quota allowance could be exceeded.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.3, 3.5 to 3.5.5, 3.4 to 3.4.8, 3.1 to 3.1.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Disable the "Email to Private files" message handler until the fix is applied. This is disabled by default in Moodle.
Tracker issue:: MDL-61738 Private files uploaded via incoming mail processing could bypass quota restrictions

Description: The form to upload cohorts contained a redirect field, which was not restricted to internal URLs.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.3, 3.5 to 3.5.5, 3.4 to 3.4.8, 3.1 to 3.1.17 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-64708 Open redirect in upload cohorts page

Description: A web service fetching messages was not restricted to the current user's conversations.
Workaround:: Disable the messaging system until the fix is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-65365 All messaging conversations could be viewed

Description: get_with_capability_join and get_users_by_capability were not taking context freezing into account when checking user capabilities
Tracker issue:: MDL-64410 get_with_capability_join/get_users_by_capability not aware of context freezing

Description: There was a link to site home within the the Boost theme's secure layout, meaning students could navigate out of the page.
Reported by:: Martin von Löwis and Luca Bösch
Tracker issue:: MDL-64706 Secure layout contained an insecure link in Boost theme

Description: Links within assignment submission comments would open directly (in the same window). Although links themselves may be valid, opening within the same window and without the no-referrer header policy made them more susceptible to exploits.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.2, 3.5 to 3.5.4, 3.4 to 3.4.7, 3.1 to 3.1.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-64651 Stored HTML in assignment submission comments allowed links to be opened directly

Description: Users could assign themselves an escalated role within courses or content accessed via LTI, by modifying the request to the LTI publisher site.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.2, 3.5 to 3.5.4, 3.4 to 3.4.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-62702 Users could elevate their role when accessing the LTI tool on a provider site

Description: Permissions were not correctly checked before loading event information into the calendar's edit event modal popup, so logged in non-guest users could view unauthorised calendar events. (Note: It was read-only access, users could not edit the events.)
Tracker issue:: MDL-64830 Logged in users could view all calendar events

Description: Users with the "login as other users" capability (such as administrators/managers) can access other users' Dashboards, but the JavaScript those other users may have added to their Dashboard was not being escaped when being viewed by the user logging in on their behalf.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.2, 3.5 to 3.5.4, 3.4 to 3.4.7, 3.1 to 3.1.16 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Use incognito/private browsing mode when using the "Log in as" functionality, then close the private window before logging back in as your own user, to minimise session or cookie related risks. Alternatively, avoid visiting the Dashboard when logged in as other users until patch is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-63786 "Log in as" functionality exposed to JavaScript risk on other users' Dashboards

Description: The /userpix/ page did not escape users' full names, which are included as text when hovering over profile images. Note this page is not linked to by default and its access is restricted.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.1, 3.5 to 3.5.3, 3.4 to 3.4.6, 3.1 to 3.1.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-64372 User full name is not escaped in the un-linked userpix page

Description: The mybackpack functionality allowed setting the URL of badges, when it should be restricted to the Mozilla Open Badges backpack URL. This resulted in the possibility of blind SSRF via requests made by the page.
Versions affected:: 3.1 to 3.1.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Ensure your firewall rules effectively protect other internal hosts and ports from unauthorised access.
Tracker issue:: MDL-64222 Blind SSRF risk in /badges/mybackpack.php

Description: The 'manage groups' capability did not have the 'XSS risk' flag assigned to it, but does have that access in certain places. Note that the capability is intended for use by trusted users, and is only assigned to teachers and managers by default.
Versions affected:: 3.6 to 3.6.1, 3.5 to 3.5.3, 3.4 to 3.4.6, 3.1 to 3.1.15 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-64395 Manage groups capability is missing XSS risk flag

Description: The breadcrumb navigation provided by Boost theme when displaying search results of a blog were insufficiently filtered, which could result in reflected XSS if a user followed a malicious link containing JavaScript in the search parameter.
Versions affected:: 3.5 to 3.5.1, 3.4 to 3.4.4, 3.3 to 3.3.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Use an alternative theme not based upon Boost until the fix is applied.
Tracker issue:: MDL-62857 Boost theme - blog search GET parameter insufficiently filtered

Description: A security vulnerability was reported against QuickForm, a third party library used by Moodle. Although no attack vector was identified within our software, Moodle has updated to patched versions of QuickForm as a precaution.
Versions affected:: 3.5 to 3.5.1, 3.4 to 3.4.4, 3.3 to 3.3.7, 3.1 to 3.1.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-62947 QuickForm library remote code vulnerability (upstream)

Description: When importing legacy 'drag and drop into text' (ddwtos) type quiz questions, it was possible to inject and execute PHP code from within the imported questions, either intentionally or by importing questions from an untrusted source.
Versions affected:: 3.5 to 3.5.1, 3.4 to 3.4.4, 3.1 to 3.1.13 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-62880 Moodle XML import of ddwtos could lead to intentional remote code execution

Description: The login form is not protected by a token to prevent login cross-site request forgery.
Versions affected:: 3.5 to 3.5.2, 3.4 to 3.4.5, 3.3 to 3.3.8, 3.1 to 3.1.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-63183 Login CSRF vulnerability in login form

Description: When a quiz question bank is imported, it was possible for the question preview that is displayed to execute JavaScript that is written into the question bank.
Versions affected:: 3.5, 3.4 to 3.4.3, 3.3 to 3.3.6, 3.2 to 3.2.9, 3.1 to 3.1.12 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-62820 Quiz question bank import preview could execute JavaScript

Description: It was possible for the core_course_get_categories web service to return hidden categories, which should be omitted when fetching course categories. Note this only affects cases where a user has access to manage categories, but does not also have permission to view hidden categories.
Versions affected:: 3.5, 3.4 to 3.4.3, 3.3 to 3.3.6, 3.2 to 3.2.9, 3.1 to 3.1.12 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-62790 core_course_get_categories may return invisible categories

Description: No option existed to omit logs from data privacy exports, which may contain details of other users who interacted with the requester. Note this may be a serious privacy consideration for sites processing data exports.
Tracker issue:: MDL-62616 Privacy data exports include log data

Description: Site policies agreement is not checked for logged in users who browse front page and activities on it
Versions affected:: 3.4 to 3.4.2, 3.3 to 3.3.5, 3.2 to 3.2.8, 3.1 to 3.1.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-61996 User who did not agree to the site policies can see the site homepage as if they had full site access

Description: Authenticated user are allowed to add HTML blocks containing scripts to their Dashboard and this is normally not a security issue because personal dashboard is visible to this user only. Through this security vulnerability users can move such block to other pages where they can be viewed by other users.
Versions affected:: 3.4 to 3.4.2, 3.3 to 3.3.5, 3.2 to 3.2.8, 3.1 to 3.1.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Prohibit capability 'moodle/my:manageblocks' from Authenticated user role until the fix is applied
Tracker issue:: MDL-62206 User can shift a block from Dashboard to any page

Description: Students who posted on forum and exported the post to portfolios can download any stored Moodle file by changing download URL
Versions affected:: 3.4 to 3.4.2, 3.3 to 3.3.5, 3.2 to 3.2.8, 3.1 to 3.1.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Disable portfolios until the fix is applied. Portfolios are disabled by default in Moodle
Tracker issue:: MDL-62232 Portfolio forum caller class allows a user to download any file

Description: Students who submitted assignments and exported it to portfolios can download any stored Moodle file by changing download URL
Versions affected:: 3.4 to 3.4.2, 3.3 to 3.3.5, 3.2 to 3.2.8, 3.1 to 3.1.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Disable portfolios until the fix is applied. Portfolios are disabled by default in Moodle
Tracker issue:: MDL-62210 Users can download any file via portfolio assignment caller class

Description: Teacher creating Calculated question can intentionally cause remote code execution on server
Versions affected:: 3.4 to 3.4.2, 3.3 to 3.3.5, 3.2 to 3.2.8, 3.1 to 3.1.11 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-62275, MDL-62469 Calculated question type allows remote code execution by Question authors

Description: If a user account using OAuth2 authentication method was once confirmed but later suspended, user could still login to the site
Tracker issue:: MDL-60101 Suspended users with OAuth 2 authentication method can still log in to the site

Description: Paypal IPN callback script should only send error emails to admin after request origin was verified, otherwise admin email can be spammed
Versions affected:: 3.4 to 3.4.1, 3.3 to 3.3.4, 3.2 to 3.2.7, 3.1 to 3.1.10 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-61392 Unauthenticated users can trigger custom messages to admin via paypal enrol script

Description: It is possible to inject javascript in the event name in the calendar block. Normally capability to create events is only given to trusted users (such as teachers), however it is not marked as having XSS risk, therefore it is considered a security issue.
Versions affected:: 3.3 to 3.3.3, 3.2 to 3.2.6, 3.1 to 3.1.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-60235 XSS in event name in block_calendar

Description: Quiz web services allow students to see quiz results when it is prohibited in the settings. This web service is used by the mobile app
Tracker issue:: MDL-60908 Students are able to see quiz results in Mobile app although it is prohibited in the settings

Description: Moodle setting "cURL blocked hosts list" was introduced in Moodle 3.2 to prevent access to specific addresses (usually internal) when server retrieves URLs requested by the user. PoC was presented how to bypass this restriction by using a DNS record that returns multiple A records for a hostname.
Tracker issue:: MDL-61143 curlsecurityblockedhosts can be bypassed with multiple A record hostnames

Description: By substituting the source URL in the filepicker AJAX request authenticated users are able to retrieve and view any URL. We classify this issue as serious because some cloud hosting providers contain internal resources that can expose data and compromise a server
Versions affected:: 3.4, 3.3 to 3.3.3, 3.2 to 3.2.6, 3.1 to 3.1.9 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-61131 Server Side Request Forgery in /repository/repository_ajax.php (Critical for Cloud Hosted Moodle Instances)

Description: Directories vendor/ and node_modules/ that are created by composer and used during Moodle development may expose dangerous scripts to the web and should never be present on production sites. This issue adds a respective security check.
Versions affected:: 3.3 to 3.3.1, 3.2 to 3.2.4, 3.1 to 3.1.7 and earlier unsupported versions
CVE identifier:: CVE-2017-9841 reported against PHPUnit project, it is relevant to the version used in Moodle development
Tracker issue:: MDL-59969 Admins may not know that exposing vendor directory is a security risk

Description: This fix may affect plugins using this API function, there is no exploit in standard Moodle
Versions affected:: 3.3 to 3.3.1, 3.2 to 3.2.4, 3.1 to 3.1.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-58953 user_can_view_profile() incorrectly assumes $course as $sharedcourse

Description: Number of course reports allowed teachers to view details about users in the groups they can't access
Versions affected:: 3.3 to 3.3.1, 3.2 to 3.2.4, 3.1 to 3.1.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-58762 Course reports are not respecting group settings in courses

Description: Form on the feedback "non-respondents" page does not escape the value of subject thus creating self-XSS. This can be used to attack another user by tricking them into opening malicious URL whilst in an open Moodle session
Versions affected:: 3.3 to 3.3.1, 3.2 to 3.2.4, 3.1 to 3.1.7 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-59972 XSS in contact form on "non-respondents" page (mod_feedback)

Description: Using search on Participants page students could search email addresses of all participants regardless of email visibility. This allows to enumerate and guess emails of other students
Versions affected:: 3.3 to 3.3.2, 3.2 to 3.2.5, 3.1 to 3.1.8 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Prohibit capability 'moodle/course:viewparticipants' (View participants) for Student role until Moodle is upgraded
Tracker issue:: MDL-60550 Students can find out email addresses of other students who set theirs to "hidden"

Description: Old CAS servers (3.3.5.1 or 3.4.2.1, both released Jul 21, 2010) do not escape the failure message which could be exploited with the phpCAS client library that is shipped as part of Moodle. Only fix for this issue was picked to phpCAS library in Moodle, the library will be upgraded to the latest version in the next major Moodle release. See also https://github.com/Jasig/phpCAS/issues/228
Versions affected:: 3.3, 3.2 to 3.2.3, 3.1 to 3.1.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-59456 Authentication bypass vulnerability on phpCAS library

Description: Insufficient permission check in "Site administration" tree allows users who have permission to access one page in the tree to change other settings.
Versions affected:: 3.3, 3.2 to 3.2.3, 3.1 to 3.1.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-59409 Course creators are able to change system default settings for courses

Description: Timeline view of the new course overview block can show events for activities that user can not yet access because the course is hidden.
Tracker issue:: MDL-59304 Course overview block reveals activities in hidden courses

Description: Some pages show full names of users as part of the permission error message even for users who do not have capability to view full names
Versions affected:: 3.3, 3.2 to 3.2.3, 3.1 to 3.1.6 and earlier unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-56565 User fullname disclosure on user preferences page

Description: Users without capability to add attachment to forum posts were able to do it via Web Services. This Web Service is used in mobile app.
Tracker issue:: MDL-58259 Forum post Web Services should check if the user has permissions to add attachments

Description: The link changing user preference of how many courses to see in their course overview block was not protected against CSRF. This represents a minor security issue since it can't be exploited for anybody's benefit, only to create confusions
Versions affected:: 3.2 to 3.2.2, 3.1 to 3.1.5, 3.0 to 3.0.9, 2.7 to 2.7.19 and other unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-58740 CSRF on my/index.php

Description: Capability to search blogs was not checked properly resulting in users being able to search blogs without permission
Versions affected:: 3.2 to 3.2.2, 3.1 to 3.1.5, 3.0 to 3.0.9, 2.7 to 2.7.19 and other unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-58670 Users can search blogs by typing full url in address bar even with capability moodle/blog:search removed from their role

Description: User could edit somebody else's external blog link. The ownership of the blog would be changed to the current user, therefore compromising other people was not possible
Versions affected:: 3.2 to 3.2.2, 3.1 to 3.1.5, 3.0 to 3.0.9, 2.7 to 2.7.19 and other unsupported versions
Tracker issue:: MDL-58635 External blog editing takeover

Description:: Incorrect capability check may have allowed users to view course notes when they had site-wide permission which was revoked inside a course
Issue summary:: Notes has_capability check not called for correct context
Versions affected:: 3.1 to 3.1.2, 3.0 to 3.0.6, 2.9 to 2.9.8, 2.8 to 2.8.12, 2.7 to 2.7.16 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Normally in Moodle web interface non-admin users with capability to edit other users can not edit information about admins, this was not respected in one of the web services. This can only be a security vulnerability if this WS was exposed to some external service; it is not exposed to the mobile app
Issue summary:: Prevent some users to be updated by update_users ws
Versions affected:: 3.1 to 3.1.2, 3.0 to 3.0.6, 2.9 to 2.9.8, 2.8 to 2.8.12, 2.7 to 2.7.16 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: User can guess URL of the file embedded in a question that they are not able to access and download it using identificator of a question they can access
Issue summary:: Question engine allows access to files that I should not be able to view
Versions affected:: 3.1 to 3.1.2, 3.0 to 3.0.6, 2.9 to 2.9.8, 2.8 to 2.8.12, 2.7 to 2.7.16 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Event monitor tool checked access to the course or activity only when subscription was created but did not re-evaluate it when sending notifications. This can result in unenrolled user receiving notifications with information they no longer can access.
Issue summary:: Event monitor notifications do not check user access to the course/activity (for example after teacher has been unenrolled)

Description:: By changing own name user can inject arbitrary email addresses in the emails that moodle sends to him/her. This can be used to send spam when moodle emails user content such as messages and forum posts. It can only be exploited by registered users and very easy to trace and find the attacker.
Issue summary:: User firstname/lastname not sanitized when sending emails
Versions affected:: 3.1, 3.0 to 3.0.4, 2.9 to 2.9.6, 2.8 to 2.8.12, 2.7 to 2.7.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Temporary prohibit users from editing their first and last names until the fix is applied

Description:: When searching in a glossary entries from other glossaries could be displayed, including the modules and courses that user can not access
Issue summary:: Possible to see glossary entries in courses you are not enrolled in

Description:: CSRF possible in the URL that marks forum posts as read
Issue summary:: Forum markposts.php missing sesskey check
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.3, 2.9 to 2.9.5, 2.8 to 2.8.11, 2.7 to 2.7.13 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: During the course restore teacher could overwrite idnumber even without having the capability to change it
Issue summary:: Course idnumber not protected from teacher restore
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.3, 2.9 to 2.9.5, 2.8 to 2.8.11, 2.7 to 2.7.13 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Capability check to view other badges was performed for the current user instead for the user whose badges are being viewed
Issue summary:: Badges code checks viewotherbadges capability in the wrong context
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.3, 2.9 to 2.9.5, 2.8 to 2.8.11, 2.7 to 2.7.13 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Name of the inaccessible forum or forum discussion could be disclosed as part of the error message on the subscription page
Issue summary:: Information disclosure of hidden forum names and sub-names.

Description:: User editing form only disabled the profile fields in UI and did not actually prevent users from editing them
Issue summary:: Tricky users can change locked profile fields
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.3, 2.9 to 2.9.5, 2.8 to 2.8.11, 2.7 to 2.7.13 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Students were able to add assignment submissions after the due date through web service
Issue summary:: External function mod_assign_save_submission does not check due dates
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Improve security when following external links that were added with _blank target
Issue summary:: Add no referrer to links with _blank target attribute
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Despite force login setting guests could still access course category details
Issue summary:: Enumeration of category details possible without authentication
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: CSRF possible on admin page, however exploit unlikely benefit anybody and can easily be reversed
Issue summary:: CSRF in Assignment plugin management page
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Users without capability to view hidden acitivites could still see associated calendar events via web services
Issue summary:: External function get_calendar_events return events that pertains to hidden activities
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Incorrect capability check in Single View grade report could result in giving a teacher extra permission
Issue summary:: Non-Editing Instructor role can edit exclude checkbox in Single View

Description:: Users without capability to view hidden courses but with capability to subscribe to Event Monitor rules could see the names of hidden courses
Issue summary:: Hidden courses are shown to students in Event Monitor

Description:: User with higher permissions could be tricked into clicking a link which would result in XSS attack
Issue summary:: Reflected XSS in mod_data advanced search
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Moodle traditionally trusted content from external DB however it was decided that external datasources may not be aware of web security practices and data could cause problems after importing to Moodle
Issue summary:: XSS from profile fields from external db
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Teachers who otherwise were not supposed to see students' emails could see them in the participants list
Issue summary:: Incorrect capability check when displaying users emails in Participants list
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.2, 2.9 to 2.9.4, 2.8 to 2.8.10, 2.7 to 2.7.12 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Search string in course management interface was not escaped when being output creating potential for XSS attack
Issue summary:: XSS Vulnerability in course management search

Description:: Web services core_enrol_get_course_enrolment_methods and enrol_self_get_instance_info did not check user permission to access hidden courses
Issue summary:: External functions core_enrol_get_course_enrolment_methods and enrol_self_get_instance_info don't check course visibility
Versions affected:: 3.0 to 3.0.1, 2.9 to 2.9.3, 2.8 to 2.8.9, 2.7 to 2.7.11 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Users can mock URL to delete or submit new responses after the choice module was closed

Versions affected:: 2.9 to 2.9.2, 2.8 to 2.8.8, 2.7 to 2.7.10 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Incorrect and missing handling of availability dates in mod_scorm let users to view the SCORM contents bypassing the date restriction
Issue summary:: Incorrect and missing handling of availability dates in mod_scorm let users to view the SCORM contents bypassing the date restriction
Versions affected:: 2.9 to 2.9.2, 2.8 to 2.8.8, 2.7 to 2.7.10 and earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Logged in users who do not have capability 'View available badges without earning them' can still access the full list of badges

Description:: Conditional access rule values for user fields wereable to contain unescaped HTML/JS that would beoutput to users.
Issue summary:: Conditional activities: user field displays asdatabase column name, values not escaped

Description:: It was possible to determine answers from ID valuesin Lesson activity matching questions.
Issue summary:: Matching question in lesson could easily manipulatedthrough view sources
Versions affected:: 2.5, 2.4 to 2.4.4, 2.3 to 2.3.7,earlier unsupported versions

Description: Apologies if this has already been answered in another thread... I did search but couldn't find anything.

Description:: Users were able to access a daemon-mode Chatactivity without the required capability.
Issue summary:: Missing privilege check inmod/chat/gui_sockets/index.php
Versions affected:: 2.5, 2.4 to 2.4.4, 2.3 to 2.3.7, 2.2 to 2.2.10,earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Use the Chat module without the daemon.

Description:: Privacy settings for the IMS-LTI (External tool)module were not able to be changed so personalinformation was always transferred.
Issue summary:: Privacy settings do not change
Versions affected:: 2.5, 2.4 to 2.4.4, 2.3 to 2.3.7, 2.2 to 2.2.10,earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Flash files distributed with the YUI librarymay have allowed for cross-site scripting attacks.
Issue summary:: YUI swf files suffer a XSS vulnerability
Versions affected:: 2.5, 2.4 to 2.4.4, 2.3 to 2.3.7, 2.2 to 2.2.10,earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Form elements named using a specific naming scheme were not being filtered correctly
Issue summary:: Elements named foo[i] are not cleaned properly
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.3, 2.3 to 2.3.6, 2.2 to 2.2.9, earlier unsupported versions

Description:: There was no check of permissions for viewing comments on blog posts.
Issue summary:: Blog comment validation should verify that the user can view a post.
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.3, 2.3 to 2.3.6, 2.2 to 2.2.9, earlier unsupported versions

Description:: When registering a site on a hub (not Moodle.net) site information was being sent to the hub regardless of settings chosen.
Issue summary:: Moodle send site information to a hub even though it's unchecked
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.3, 2.3 to 2.3.6, 2.2 to 2.2.9, earlier unsupported versions

Description:: The Gradebook's Overview report was showing grade totals that may have incorrectly included hidden grades.
Issue summary:: The method for figuring out showtotalsifcontainhidden on the overview report is flawed
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.3, 2.3 to 2.3.6, earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Ensure all courses have the same value for hiding grades in the gradebook. This is set at Administration > Grades > Course grade settings > Hide totals if they contain hidden items

Description:: The assignment module was not checking capabilities for users downloading all assignments as a zip.
Issue summary:: Students can download assignments submitted by other students

Description:: Any user able to view WebDav repositories was able to view, edit and delete site-wide WebDav repositories
Issue summary:: Site-wide WebDAV repository instances options are accessible
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions (2.x only)

Description:: Users able to use "login as" were able to see the personal repository content of the user they were impersonating
Issue summary:: Admin users logged in as another user have access to the content of their external repositories
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions (2.x only)

Description:: By manipulating form elements it was possible to assign a note to a different user during editing
Issue summary:: Go to the edit notes form, change userid in the html with firebug => the targeted note user is changed
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions (1.9 onwards)
Workaround:: Disable notes

Description:: Through the Zend library, clients of Moodle Web services were potentially able to reveal files on the server
Issue summary:: Zend XmlRpc: Local file disclosure via XXE injection
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions (2.x only)
Workaround:: Disable Web services

Description:: It was possible to upload files with filenames containing HTML and JavaScript
Issue summary:: Code injection (XSS) possible in File Picker
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions (2.x only)
Workaround:: Avoid the filesystem repository on Linux file systems and the Google Docs/Drive repository

Description:: The password for a WebDav repository was not hidden on the repository configuration form
Issue summary:: WebDav repository password field is plain text allowing admin to see password
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions (2.x only)
Workaround:: Avoid WebDav repositories requiring personal passwords

Description:: Exception messages were revealing server file system information
Issue summary:: Server system path revealed through exception messages
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions

Description:: Course profiles were accessible without logging in as a real user
Issue summary:: Course profiles open to google even when forceloginforprofiles is enabled
Versions affected:: 2.4 to 2.4.1, 2.3 to 2.3.4, 2.2 to 2.2.7, earlier unsupported versions
Workaround:: Leave autologinguests and opentogoogle settings disabled (default)

Description:: Users without appropriate capabilities were shown controls to update calendar subscriptions, even though the were not able to modify subscriptions.
Issue summary:: Student should not be able to see the subscription which they cant manage

Description: Student user able to Remove imported calendar from Manage Subscriptions
Description:: Students were able to delete course level calendar subscriptions created by teachers.
Issue summary:: Student user able to Remove imported calendar from Manage Subscriptions

Description: Blog posts still available via RSS even after the blogging is disabled
Description:: Blog posts were still accessible via the blog RSS feed, even after blogging was disabled globally.
Issue summary:: Blog posts still available via RSS even after the blogging is disabled

Description: Guest users can access RSS feed for site level blogs
Description:: Blog posts that were hidden from guest users in the Web interface were being included in the related RSS feed.
Issue summary:: Guest users can access RSS feed for site level blogs
Workaround:: Disable blogging

Description: Course message sending can be exploited by CSRF
Description:: The messaging system was not checking the user's session correctly when messages are sent.
Issue summary:: Course message sending can be exploited by CSRF

Description: Assignment comment permissions are not being validated
Description:: Through URL manipulation, students were able to view feedback comments provided on other student's submissions.
Issue summary:: Assignment comment permissions are not being validated

Description: Open redirect issues
Description:: Insufficient filtering of return URLs on some pages was allowing redirects to sites outside Moodle.
Issue summary:: Open redirect issues

Description: Activity Report showing lastaccess even if it is a hidden field
Description:: Under certain circumstances, when last access is included in a list of fields forced to be hidden, the Activity report would still reveal users' last access.
Issue summary:: Activity Report showing lastaccess even if it is a hidden field

Description: moodle1 backup converter path not properly validated
Description:: Paths in backups to restorable files were not being sufficiently validated and could be manipulated to gain access to files on the server.
Issue summary:: moodle1 backup converter path not properly validated

Description: Teachers can set Outcomes to be Standard when re-editing
Description:: Users without the appropriate capability were able to set a custom outcome they had created as a standard site-wide capability when editing that outcome.
Issue summary:: Teachers can set Outcomes to be Standard when re-editing

Description: import tinymce spellchecker 2.0.6.1
Description:: A security issue was reported by TinyMCE. This fix has been applied to Moodle.
Issue summary:: import tinymce spellchecker 2.0.6.1
Workaround:: Disable spellchecker plugin
